messages.message:
@Siya @tj.serkes The design still doesn't reflect what we discussed here. As you can see in the screen recording, the color of the icons and the color of the texts are inconsistent. The credit icon is gray 40, and the home icon and other icons are gray 20. the plus icon button is gray 60. The color of "home" is gray 60, the color of "provide feedback", "documentation" and "log out" is gray 70, and the color of "xxx credit available" is #6D6D6D which is gray 60. The "projects" "conversations" header is gray 30, which doesn't match the header design for the Pollen BetaSideNav component

cc @Heymian @hannah @alagu

At this point, I'm not going to follow the design. Rather, I'll just make sure the colors are consistent throughout the nav bar. This is what I have:
• All the icons use gray 40
• All the texts next to the icons use gray 70
• The icon button for creating new projects uses gray 60, which is the default setting from Pollen icon button (see attached)
• The header "projects" and "conversations" use gray 40, which matches the nav header from Pollen BetaSideNav component (see attached)
cc @Heymian @Heymian @alagu

PR is up: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/49955

After this is merged, I plan on backport it to 23.45 and will make sure that the org context avatar will show up.

We are very close to 23.45 GA and i don't think it makes sense to block GA. Lmk if we want to change anything after the 23.45 release.
Ah, one more change, added top margin for the context switcher

btw, based on the spacing in the design, the avatar will "jump to the right" when the navbar open/collapse. To address that, the left padding for both open and collapsed states should be the same. The avatar is bigger than other icons so the padding in the collapsed state has to be smaller to make it look centered horizontally. One way to solve this is to make the context switcher's left padding a bit smaller.

I think we need a design for the collapsed state. I originally made the context switcher close to the home button so that when the nav bar is collapses, the avatar is directly below the home icon. See attached for comparison.
